content.raw: this looks good to me. Images can also be saved to disk by adding `<save enabled="true">` to the camera sdf element. Waiting for last round of jenkins builds
content.html: this looks good to me. Images can also be saved to disk by adding <save enabled="true"> to the camera sdf element. Waiting for last round of jenkins builds

content.raw:
Once [this PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/190/add-support-to-imagedisplay-for-depth/diff) is released, we can add this plugin:

~~~
      <plugin filename="ImageDisplay" name="Image Display">
        <ignition-gui>
          <property key="state" type="string">docked</property>
        </ignition-gui>
      </plugin>
~~~

To show the camera images:

![depth_cam.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2905843959-depth_cam.gif)
content.html:
Once this PR is released, we can add this plugin:

      <plugin filename="ImageDisplay" name="Image Display">
        <ignition-gui>
          <property key="state" type="string">docked</property>
        </ignition-gui>
      </plugin>

To show the camera images:

content.raw:
I’m getting a crash running the `depth_camera_sensors.sdf` world. Not sure if you’ve seen this but the backtrace points to:

```
0x00007fffc22d7123 in ignition::rendering::v1::Ogre2RenderTexture::RenderTarget() const ()
    at /home/ian/code/ign_gz_ws/src/ign-rendering/ogre2/src/Ogre2RenderTarget.cc:260
260	  return this->ogreTexture->getBuffer()->getRenderTarget();
```

The integration does not crash but the test fails for me:

```
/home/ian/code/ign_gz_ws/src/ign-gazebo/test/integration/depth_camera.cc:114: Failure
Value of: ignition::math::INF_D
  Actual: inf
Expected: depthBuffer[first]
Which is: 1.5240719318389893
/home/ian/code/ign_gz_ws/src/ign-gazebo/test/integration/depth_camera.cc:115: Failure
The difference between depthBuffer[mid] and expectedRangeAtMidPointBox1 is 1.0740724086761475, which exceeds 1e-4, where
depthBuffer[mid] evaluates to 1.5240724086761475,
expectedRangeAtMidPointBox1 evaluates to 0.45000000000000001, and
1e-4 evaluates to 0.0001.
/home/ian/code/ign_gz_ws/src/ign-gazebo/test/integration/depth_camera.cc:116: Failure
Value of: ignition::math::INF_D
  Actual: inf
Expected: depthBuffer[last]
Which is: 1.5033360719680786
```
content.html:
I’m getting a crash running the depth_camera_sensors.sdf world. Not sure if you’ve seen this but the backtrace points to:

0x00007fffc22d7123 in ignition::rendering::v1::Ogre2RenderTexture::RenderTarget() const ()
    at /home/ian/code/ign_gz_ws/src/ign-rendering/ogre2/src/Ogre2RenderTarget.cc:260
260   return this->ogreTexture->getBuffer()->getRenderTarget();

The integration does not crash but the test fails for me:

/home/ian/code/ign_gz_ws/src/ign-gazebo/test/integration/depth_camera.cc:114: Failure
Value of: ignition::math::INF_D
  Actual: inf
Expected: depthBuffer[first]
Which is: 1.5240719318389893
/home/ian/code/ign_gz_ws/src/ign-gazebo/test/integration/depth_camera.cc:115: Failure
The difference between depthBuffer[mid] and expectedRangeAtMidPointBox1 is 1.0740724086761475, which exceeds 1e-4, where
depthBuffer[mid] evaluates to 1.5240724086761475,
expectedRangeAtMidPointBox1 evaluates to 0.45000000000000001, and
1e-4 evaluates to 0.0001.
/home/ian/code/ign_gz_ws/src/ign-gazebo/test/integration/depth_camera.cc:116: Failure
Value of: ignition::math::INF_D
  Actual: inf
Expected: depthBuffer[last]
Which is: 1.5033360719680786
